column4:
The Central Bank began publishing National Accounts estimates in 1959. Estimates for the period 1950 - 1958 have been computed using the growth rates in “Estimates 
of Sri Lanka’s Gross National Product from 1950 - 1981”, T. Savundranayagam, Staff Studies Vol. 12 No.2 September 1982 and Vol. 13 No.1 and 2 April - September, 
1983. Therefore, from 1950-1958 the sum of sectoral shares does not add to 100%. National Accounts data from 2002 onwards are based on the estimates of the

Department of Census and Statistics (DCS). National Accounts estimates were rebased in 1970, 1982, and 1996 by the Central Bank and in 2002 and 2010 by the DCS.
The GDP and GNI estimates before the base year revisions are given below.
1970 (CBSL estimates) : GDP (current factor cost prices) = Rs.  11,705 mn, GNI (current factor cost prices) = Rs.   12,671 mn
1982 (CBSL estimates) : GDP (current factor cost prices) = Rs.  91,943 mn, GNI (current factor cost prices) = Rs.   89,609 mn
1996 (CBSL estimates) : GDP (current factor cost prices) = Rs.695,934 mn, GNI (current factor cost prices) = Rs. 684,676 mn
2002 (CBSL estimates) : GDP (current market prices) = Rs. 1,581,885 mn, GNI (current market prices) =  Rs. 1,599,867 mn
This series has been computed by splicing several series of implicit GDP deflators obtained with different base years. Hence, it would differ from a series compiled using

the current and constant values of GDP.
